intro: Senecio urubamlbensis, commonly known as the Urubamlen mountain groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and arranged in a basal rosette, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Senecio urubamlbensis is often found in open grasslands and is relatively uncommon in the wild.
